properties.description: Visit any of our libraries in Kent for a warm welcome. Browse our shelves, catch up with friends online with our free computer and WiFi access, or meet new people at one of our friendly social groups. Share a story, visit our cheery children's areas with little ones or pop along to one of our regular events. Many other services and partners also use libraries for drop-in surgeries. Please visit our website for services at your local library

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 1st November 2023** Our warm Welcome is a friendly, accessible space in the centre of Oxted; a space that is open to all. Encompassing everything libraries have to offer:- books for pleasure and for learning, as well as free Wi-Fi, computer access, and a place to relax and recharge. We also now offer free hot drinks, activity packs (puzzles, colouring packs, card/board games, crochet sets, knitting sets)

properties.description: Where Coffee, Cake and Chat are brought to you for free. Community coming together. Free advice dates to look out for: 24th Oct, Giveaway of garden Crocus bulbs 7th November we will be joined by SELCE to provide a free domestic energy workshop 12th December, Bromleys Principle Loneliness Champion to visit We also have a childrens play area, blankets and scarves available. Closed 3rd Tuesday of the month.
properties.title: The Free Hub

properties.description: Helping our Community through the cost of living crisis. Offering free hot breakfast and refreshments, warm space, play area, shower facilities, mobile charging and PC use. All ages welcome. Open every Saturday 10am to 12.30pm
properties.title: The Lounge

properties.address: Eynsford Riverside Club, Dartford, Kent DA4 0AE
properties.description: This is open every Wednesday from 9-1. It is for all ages.Breakfast, coffee cake and lunch are served- all with healthy options and special diets catered for . There are lots of activities available and you can bring your own to share. There is also snooker and darts. There is Citizens Advice in person on the first Wednesday of every month and a dedicated hub for CAB access direct at all times. We have internet access , computing support as well as printing scanning facilities. It is an exciting place to be , amazingly welcoming and supportive .
properties.title: The Space

This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: STEP FREE ACCESS. Hot drinks, homemade cakes, soup, sausage rolls, and more are served. As well as The Cafe we have a quiet room in the hall where people can work from. Free Wi-Fi and power sockets, tables and chairs are available. Come and join us for as long or as short a time as you wish, meeting with friends or making new ones. The Elderberry Cafe is held in the church hall and you can enter via the church car park. Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know:

properties.description: Organisation running the Warm Centre: Green Street Green Baptish Church - Warm Welcome First line of address of Warm Centre venue: 1 Worlds End Lane Town: Orpington County: Kent Postcode - please enter full postcode: BR6 6AA Contact email for public enquiries: church.office@gsgbaptist.org.uk Phone number for public enquiries: 01689 860113 Enter your website: www.gsgbaptist.org.uk Enter details of any social media accounts if you would like to engage with us and others online: Please provide details of your open times. e.g Mondays 10-2pm and Fridays 1pm- 3pm: Mondays 10am-1pm Do you provide teas/coffees?: yes Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: yes Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: We offer refreshments, lunch, wifi, board games and friendship, all FREE of charge. In addition to the Warm welcome we run the following: Indoor Bowls club (2nd & 4th Tuesday of every month 2pm-4pm) an over 60s Tea Room (1st Thursday of every month 2pm-4pm) Lilac Lounge Community Lunch (3rd Thursday of every month 12.30pm - 2.30pm) Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: We have been running Warm Welcome every Monday since November 2022 and we intend to keep this gping for as long as it is needed. Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know: We also run Toddler Time every Wednesday 10am-11.45am for children under school age and is term time only. There is a small charge of £2 per child
properties.title: Green Street Green Baptish Church

properties.description: Organisation running the Warm Centre: Bromley Libraries / GLL First line of address of Warm Centre venue: Hayes Street Town: Bromley County: Kent Postcode - please enter full postcode: BR2 7LH Contact email for public enquiries: hayes.library@gll.org Phone number for public enquiries: 0208 4622445 Enter your website: https://www.better.org.uk/library/london/bromley/hayes-library Enter details of any social media accounts if you would like to engage with us and others online: Facebook - Bromley Libraries; Instagram and X @BromleyLibraries Please provide details of your open times. e.g Mondays 10-2pm and Fridays 1pm- 3pm: Tuesday 9:30 am–1 pm, 2–5:30 pm; Thursday 9:30 am–1 pm, 2–5:30 pm; Saturday 9:30 am–1 pm, 2–5 pm Do you provide teas/coffees?: yes Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: yes Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: On Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday mornings we offer a warm and comfortable place to relax with free teas and coffees on request. We have a community jigsaw puzzle, newspapers to read, some board games, phone charging points, and Lego to play with on request. On Tuesdays and Thursdays we run children's activities including Baby Bounce and Rhyme and Stay and Play, and on Saturdays we run a children's craft. All welcome. Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Opening beginning of November 2024 through to end of February 2025 Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know:
